data.text: @charles_haig01 You are just as simple-minded as the politicians.

@charles_haig01 Correct. Vax rates too. Perspective is crucial. I live in a country of less than 10 m with 44,000 deaths to date (1 of the highest fatality rates in the world) and where vaccination has stalled at 70%. The Australian response has been exemplary, even with the many hiccups.
@charles_haig01 Our two major cities have some of, if not the longest lockdowns, in the world?
@916_stevo @charles_haig01 That clearly showed when Morrison tried to weld.
@charles_haig01 If the goal was solely to keep Covid deaths down we’ve done great. If that was the sole goal then we are run by idiots.
@916_stevo I agree in that respect. My comment is more about the hyperbole, especially on here and in certain quarters of the media, and by politicians.

@charles_haig01 Australia’s response is a failure due to the fact we overreacted and ruined a huge chance to come out of the pandemic in a much stronger economic position. The long term effects of lockdowns will far outweigh potential damage of a more balanced response to Covid
